Package ru.golubev.openweathersdk.exception

Class WeatherExceptionHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • ru.golubev.openweathersdk.exception.WeatherExceptionHandler
  • public class WeatherExceptionHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility class for parsing OpenWeather API error responses and converting them to appropriate exception types.

    This handler processes JSON error responses from the OpenWeather API and maps them to specific exception classes based on the HTTP status code and error content. This provides more granular error handling for API consumers.

    Error code mapping:

    Mapping of HTTP codes to exception types
    HTTP Code Exception Type Description
    401 ApiKeyException Invalid or unauthorized API key
    404 NotFoundException City or resource not found
    429 TooManyRequests Rate limit exceeded
    500, 502, 503, 504 InternalApiException Server-side errors
    Other codes WeatherApiException Generic API exception

    Example usage in API client:

    
 if (!response.isSuccessful()) {
     String errorBody = response.body().string();
     WeatherApiException exception = WeatherExceptionHandler.parse(
         response.message(), errorBody);
     throw exception;
 }

    Fallback behavior: If JSON parsing fails, returns a generic WeatherApiException with code -1 and "Unknown error" message.

    Since:
    1.0
    See Also:
    WeatherApiException, ErrorResponse

    • Method Detail

      • parse

        public WeatherApiException parse​(java.lang.String status,
                                 java.lang.String payload)
        Parses OpenWeather API error response and returns appropriate exception.
        Parameters:
        status - HTTP status text from the response
        payload - JSON error response body from OpenWeather API
        Returns:
        specific WeatherApiException subclass based on error code

        Parsing process:

        1. Deserializes JSON payload to ErrorResponse object
        2. Extracts error code and message
        3. Maps to specific exception type based on code
        4. Returns generic exception if parsing fails

        Example error response JSON:

        
 {
   "cod": 401,
   "message": "Invalid API key"
 }
